name: FRotationRetargetingInfo
doc:
The FRotationRetargetingInfo is used to provide all of the
settings required to perform rotational retargeting on a single
transform.

bEnabled: Set to true this enables retargeting
Source: The source transform of the frame of reference. The rotation is made relative to this space
Target: The target transform to project the rotation. In most cases this is the same as Source
RotationComponent: The rotation component to perform retargeting with
TwistAxis: In case the rotation component is SwingAngle or TwistAngle this vector is used as the twist axis
bUseAbsoluteAngle: If set to true the angle will be always positive, thus resulting in mirrored rotation both ways
SourceMinimum: The minimum value of the source angle in degrees
SourceMaximum: The maximum value of the source angle in degrees
TargetMinimum: The minimum value of the target angle in degrees (can be the same as SourceMinimum)
TargetMaximum: The target value of the target angle in degrees (can be the same as SourceMaximum)
EasingType: The easing to use - pick linear if you don't want to apply any easing
CustomCurve: Custom curve mapping to apply if bApplyCustomCurve is true
bFlipEasing: If set to true the interpolation value for the easing will be flipped (1.0 - Value)
EasingWeight: The amount of easing to apply (value should be 0.0 to 1.0)
bClamp: If set to true the value for the easing will be clamped between 0.0 and 1.0
